condition.description:
Nearly everyone has had indigestion at one time. It's a feeling of discomfort or a burning feeling in your upper abdomen. You may have heartburn or belch and feel bloated. You may also feel nauseated, or even throw up.

You might get indigestion from eating too much or too fast, eating high-fat foods, or eating when you're stressed. Smoking, drinking too much alcohol, using some medicines, being tired, and having ongoing stress can also cause indigestion or make it worse. Sometimes the cause is a problem with the digestive tract, like an ulcer or GERD.

Avoiding foods and situations that seem to cause it may help. Because indigestion can be a sign of a more serious problem, see your health care provider if it lasts for more than two weeks or if you have severe pain or other symptoms. Your health care provider may use x-rays, lab tests, and an upper endoscopy to diagnose the cause. You may need medicines to treat the symptoms.

NIH: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases
condition.name: Indigestion

carousel_items: Don't take Alka-Seltzer if you're allergic to aspirin.
Take it with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
This medicine isn't recommended for kids 12 and younger because it has aspirin in it.
Stop taking this right away and talk to your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, rash, trouble breathing, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.
Having a dental or medical procedure? You may need to stop taking this before the big day. Ask your dentist or doctor.
Alka-Seltzer contains sodium. If you need to follow a low sodium diet a different medication would be better for you.
Not a good choice if you have stomach bleeding, bleeding problems, diabetes, or gout, or if you're taking medicines to thin your blood.

basics.benefits_moa: Alka-Seltzer is a combination medicine. Sodium bicarbonate is an antacid that relieves heartburn and acid tummy (indigestion). Aspirin is a pain reliever that treats headache and body pains.
basics.bottom_line: Alka-Seltzer gives quick relief for headache, body pains, and upset tummies, but might be hard to swallow if you don't like the taste or fizz.
downsides: Doesn't last very long.
Other antacids like Zantac (H2 blockers) and omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can work better and last longer.
Because it has aspirin in it, it increases the risk of bleeding, especially if you take any other blood thinning medicine.
Can't be used by people with allergy to aspirin.
You may not like the taste or fizz.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't last very long.
Other antacids like Zantac (H2 blockers) and omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can work better and last longer.
Because it has aspirin in it, it increases the risk of bleeding, especially if you take any other blood thinning medicine.
Can't be used by people with allergy to aspirin.
You may not like the taste or fizz.

upsides: Works great if you have an upset stomach and a headache or body pain at the same time.
Works really fast.
Available over the counter without a prescription.
Cheap.

drugs.one_liner: Relieves heartburn, headache, and body pains.
drugs.name: Alka-Seltzer

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don't take Alka-Seltzer if you're allergic to aspirin.
Take it with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
This medicine isn't recommended for kids 12 and younger because it has aspirin in it.
Stop taking this right away and talk to your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, rash, trouble breathing, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.
Having a dental or medical procedure? You may need to stop taking this before the big day. Ask your dentist or doctor.
Alka-Seltzer contains sodium. If you need to follow a low sodium diet a different medication would be better for you.
Not a good choice if you have stomach bleeding, bleeding problems, diabetes, or gout, or if you're taking medicines to thin your blood.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Alka-Seltzer.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Alka-Seltzer.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: High blood sodium levels
risks_warnings.description: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Alka-Seltzer can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of sodium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Alka-Seltzer; a different antacid would be better for you.

description_processed.orig: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Alka-Seltzer can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of sodium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Alka-Seltzer; a different antacid would be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: May worsen heart or kidney problems
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer contains sodium. Sodium can raise blood pressure and cause your body to hold on to water. If you have high blood pressure, heart failure, or kidney disease you should not take Alka-Seltzer.

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer contains sodium. Sodium can raise blood pressure and cause your body to hold on to water. If you have high blood pressure, heart failure, or kidney disease you should not take Alka-Seltzer.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage or death from Reye's Syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.
risk_factors: Children 18 years or younger recovering from viral infections

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach Bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer can cause serious stomach problems that include swelling, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life threatening and can cause death. The chances that a stomach problem will occur might be worse the longer you take this medication but it can happen at any time.  Watch out for blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.  This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Drinking 3 or more alcoholic drinks a day

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer can cause serious stomach problems that include swelling, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life threatening and can cause death. The chances that a stomach problem will occur might be worse the longer you take this medication but it can happen at any time.  Watch out for blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.  This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. This is rare. Stop taking Alka-Seltzer and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. This is rare. Stop taking Alka-Seltzer and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer may cause birth defects. Don't use Alka-Seltzer while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Alka-Seltzer may cause birth defects. Don't use Alka-Seltzer while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

carousel_items: Take 1-3 hours after a meal.
Take 1-2 hours apart from other medication that you take by mouth.
Tell your doctor if you have severe diarrhea or constipation.
People with kidney disease may need to avoid Maalox. Ask your doctor.

basics.benefits_moa: Maalox is a combination medicine for stomach trouble. Aluminum and magnesium are antacids that relieve heartburn and acid tummy (indigestion). Simethicone relieves gas and bloating.
basics.bottom_line: Maalox gives quick relief for heartburn, gas, and bloating. It may not be as effective or last as long as alternative antacids though.
downsides: Doesn't last very long.
Other antacids like Zantac (H2 blockers) and omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can work better and last longer.
Some people don't care for the taste.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't last very long.

Some people don't care for the taste.

upsides: Works really fast.
Available over the counter without a prescription.
Cheap.

drugs.name: Maalox

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take 1-3 hours after a meal.
Take 1-2 hours apart from other medication that you take by mouth.
Tell your doctor if you have severe diarrhea or constipation.
People with kidney disease may need to avoid Maalox. Ask your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: Elderly are more likely to have stomach side effects like diarrhea or constipation while using Maalox.  Diarrhea can increase your risk for an electrolyte imbalance in your blood. You may need to stop taking Maalox and talk with your doctor about an alternative.

description_processed.orig: Elderly are more likely to have stomach side effects like diarrhea or constipation while using Maalox.  Diarrhea can increase your risk for an electrolyte imbalance in your blood. You may need to stop taking Maalox and talk with your doctor about an alternative.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Maalox.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Maalox.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: High blood mineral levels
risks_warnings.description: If you have kidney disease Maalox can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of aluminum or magnesium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Maalox; a different antacid would be better for you.

description_processed.orig: If you have kidney disease Maalox can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of aluminum or magnesium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Maalox; a different antacid would be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Maalox can prevent other medications from working properly.  It does this by keeping them from getting out of your stomach and into your system. Whenever possible try to take Maalox 1-2 apart from your other medicines.

description_processed.orig: Maalox can prevent other medications from working properly.  It does this by keeping them from getting out of your stomach and into your system. Whenever possible try to take Maalox 1-2 apart from your other medicines.

carousel_items: Short-term treatment of ulcers and acid reflux.

basics.benefits_moa: Famotidine is a type of antacid called an H2 blocker. It blocks the chemical histamine, which lowers acid production in your stomach. This treats heartburn and helps ulcers heal.
basics.bottom_line: Famotidine works well for heartburn but may not last as long or start working as quickly as other antacids.
downsides: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Famotidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Famotidine (H2 blockers).
Can cause more serious side effects for people with kidney disease. Ask your doctor to give you a lower dose or choose a different option.

downsides_processed.orig: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Famotidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Famotidine (H2 blockers).
Can cause more serious side effects for people with kidney disease. Ask your doctor to give you a lower dose or choose a different option.

upsides: Most people can take Famotidine without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Famotidine lasts longer than many other antacids like Maalox and Tums, and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.
Few drug interactions.

upsides_processed.orig: Most people can take Famotidine without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.

Few drug interactions.

drugs.name: Pepcid

carousel_items_processed.orig: Short-term treatment of ulcers and acid reflux.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Famotidine for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Famotidine for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Because Famotidine is processed by the kidney it can cause some worrisome side effects for people with kidney problems. These include confusion, delirium, and a dangerous irregular heartbeat known as QT prolongation.   If you have kidney problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.

description_processed.orig: Because Famotidine is processed by the kidney it can cause some worrisome side effects for people with kidney problems. These include confusion, delirium, and a dangerous irregular heartbeat known as QT prolongation.   If you have kidney problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Famotidine can cause an allergic reaction.  The reaction might cause swelling of the throat, face, lips or tongue, difficulty breathing, or rash. If this happens to you stop taking Famotidine and get medical help right away. Do not take Famotidine if you have ever had an allergic reaction to similar medications like zantac or tagamet.

description_processed.orig: Famotidine can cause an allergic reaction.  The reaction might cause swelling of the throat, face, lips or tongue, difficulty breathing, or rash. If this happens to you stop taking Famotidine and get medical help right away. Do not take Famotidine if you have ever had an allergic reaction to similar medications like zantac or tagamet.

carousel_items: Chew or dissolve chewable tablets in mouth.
Shake Pepto Bismol liquid well before using. Use dosing cup that comes with bottle to get the best dose.
You can take a dose every 1/2 to 1 hour but don't take more than 8 doses in 24 hours.
Chewable tablets and liquid are not for children under 12 years.
Use until diarrhea stops but not more than 2 days. Let your doctor know if your symptoms don't go away after 2 days.
Don't take Pepto Bismol if you have an allergy to aspirin or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs).

Don't give Pepto Bismol to children or teenagers who have or are getting better from chickenpox, the flu or other viral sickness because of the risk of getting Reye's Syndrome. Reye's syndrome causes brain and liver damage.
Can temporarily make your tongue and stools darker.
Stop taking Pepto Bismol and tell your doctor if you notice ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea and vomiting.
Not a good choice if you have stomach bleeding, bleeding problems, diabetes, gout or are taking medicines to thin your blood.

basics.benefits_moa: Pepto Bismol is a stomach and intestine medicine with multiple effects. It relieves diarrhea by helping your intestines absorb water and electrolytes, and by lowering intestine inflammation and movement. It also has antibacterial and antacid effects.
basics.bottom_line: Pepto Bismol does it all, from upset stomach to crampy diarrhea.
downsides: You might be surprised that Pepto Bismol can cause temporary darkening of your tongue, but it's harmless.
Doesn't treat every intestinal infection so make sure you let your doctor know if your diarrhea and symptoms last more than 2 days or your symptoms get worse. You may need a stronger medicine.

downsides_processed.orig: You might be surprised that Pepto Bismol can cause temporary darkening of your tongue, but it's harmless.
Doesn't treat every intestinal infection so make sure you let your doctor know if your diarrhea and symptoms last more than 2 days or your symptoms get worse. You may need a stronger medicine.

upsides: Most people who take Pepto Bismol feel there's no hassle and it's definitely worth it!
It's can also be used as part of treatment plan for H. Pylori., a stomach infection. H. Pylori is thought to be one of the reasons some people get ulcers.
It comes in caplets, liquid, and chewable tablets so you can use it anywhere you need it.

upsides_processed.orig: Most people who take Pepto Bismol feel there's no hassle and it's definitely worth it!
It's can also be used as part of treatment plan for H. Pylori., a stomach infection. H. Pylori is thought to be one of the reasons some people get ulcers.
It comes in caplets, liquid, and chewable tablets so you can use it anywhere you need it.

drugs.one_liner: Relieves heartburn, upset tummy and diarrhea.
drugs.name: Pepto Bismol

You can take a dose every 1/2 to 1 hour but don't take more than 8 doses in 24 hours.
Chewable tablets and liquid are not for children under 12 years.
Use until diarrhea stops but not more than 2 days. Let your doctor know if your symptoms don't go away after 2 days.

Don't give Pepto Bismol to children or teenagers who have or are getting better from chickenpox, the flu or other viral sickness because of the risk of getting Reye's Syndrome. Reye's syndrome causes brain and liver damage.

risks_warnings.title: Reye's syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. don't give Pepto Bismol to children or teenagers who are sick with or getting better from chickenpox, the flu or other viral sickness because of the risk of getting Reyes Syndrome. Reyes is a serious condition that causes damage to the liver and brain.
risk_factors: Children or teenagers that have or are recovering from flu/flu-like symptoms or chickenpox

description_processed.orig: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. don't give Pepto Bismol to children or teenagers who are sick with or getting better from chickenpox, the flu or other viral sickness because of the risk of getting Reyes Syndrome. Reyes is a serious condition that causes damage to the liver and brain.

risks_warnings.title: Risk to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Using Pepto Bismol, an aspirin-type medicine is not recommended during pregnancy. Talk to your baby doctor about other medication choices to treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: Using Pepto Bismol, an aspirin-type medicine is not recommended during pregnancy. Talk to your baby doctor about other medication choices to treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. People who are allergic to aspirin can have a reaction to Pepto Bismol. Stop taking Pepto Bismol and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

description_processed.orig: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. People who are allergic to aspirin can have a reaction to Pepto Bismol. Stop taking Pepto Bismol and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Bleeding problems
risks_warnings.description: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. If you have a history of stomach or intestinal problems that include ulcers or bleeding or if you have a bleeding problem (hemophilia) you may be at risk of bleeding. The chances this happens is greater the longer you take this medication but it can happen at any time. Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Drinking 3 or more alcoholic drinks a day

description_processed.orig: Pepto Bismol breaks down into salicylic acid or aspirin in the body after you swallow it. If you have a history of stomach or intestinal problems that include ulcers or bleeding or if you have a bleeding problem (hemophilia) you may be at risk of bleeding. The chances this happens is greater the longer you take this medication but it can happen at any time. Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.

risks_warnings.title: Hearing problems
risks_warnings.description: Pepto Bismol may cause ringing in ears (tinnitus) and loss of hearing higher tones. Older people are more sensitive and should be careful  not to take too much.

description_processed.orig: Pepto Bismol may cause ringing in ears (tinnitus) and loss of hearing higher tones. Older people are more sensitive and should be careful  not to take too much.

carousel_items: Take at the first sign of discomfort.
You might need to take more than once a day but pay attention to the instructions on your bottle to avoid overdosing.
Take 1-2 hours apart from other medication that you take by mouth.
If heartburn doesn't improve or lasts more than 2 weeks, talk to your doctor.
People with kidney disease on dialysis may need to take a lower dose or avoid use. Your doctor can do blood tests to see if it's safe to use.
Don't take if you have high blood calcium levels.

downsides: Doesn't last very long.
Other antacids like Zantac (H2 blockers) and omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can work better and last longer.
Some chalky aftertaste.

risks_warnings.title: High blood calcium
risks_warnings.description: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Rolaids can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of calcium in your body. risk_factors: Taking high doses of Vitamin D

description_processed.orig: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Rolaids can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of calcium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Rolaids; a different antacid would be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney stones
risks_warnings.description: Rolaids contains calcium.  Calcium can be an ingredient in some kidney stones.  If you have had kidney stones in the past (especially the calcium-containing kind) be careful using Rolaids. Use the lowest dose for the shortest time possible or just play it safe and use a different antacid instead.

carousel_items: Dissolve 2 tablets in 4 ounces of water. Drink when fully dissolved.
Sodium bicarbonate contains sodium. If you're following a low-salt diet, a different medication would be better for you.
If youre using Sodium bicarbonate a lot, talk to your doctor about other options for your heartburn and make sure nothing more serious is going on.
Try not to eat right before bedtime to help your heartburn.
Make sure the other medicines youre taking dont interact with Sodium bicarbonate.

basics.benefits_moa: Sodium bicarbonate is an antacid. It stops stomach acid from causing heartburn and indigestion.
basics.bottom_line: Sodium bicarbonate works fast to help your stomach feel better, but it doesnt work very long.
downsides: Only lasts about 10 minutes, so it's not the best option if you get heartburn or indigestion throughout the day.
Doesnt prevent heartburn or indigestion.
Sodium bicarbonate contains sodium, so its not the best choice if you have problems with too much fluid in your body or high blood pressure.
Sodium bicarbonate makes your stomach less acidic, but some medicines need an acidic environment to work well. You may need to take this at different times of the day from your other medications.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Alka-Seltzer. Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: High blood sodium levels
risks_warnings.description: Sodium bicarbonate contains sodium. If you have kidney disease, its harder for your body to get rid of sodium, so taking Sodium bicarbonate could lead to toxic levels of sodium in your blood. You should talk to your doctor about other options for treating heartburn.

description_processed.orig: Sodium bicarbonate contains sodium. If you have kidney disease, its harder for your body to get rid of sodium, so taking Sodium bicarbonate could lead to toxic levels of sodium in your blood. You should talk to your doctor about other options for treating heartburn.

risks_warnings.title: May worsen heart problems
risks_warnings.description: If you have problems with fluid retention, taking Sodium bicarbonate can make this worse. This is because Sodium bicarbonate contains sodium, and sodium causes your body to hold onto extra water, which can raise your blood pressure. You should talk to your doctor about other options for treating heartburn.

description_processed.orig: If you have problems with fluid retention, taking Sodium bicarbonate can make this worse. This is because Sodium bicarbonate contains sodium, and sodium causes your body to hold onto extra water, which can raise your blood pressure. You should talk to your doctor about other options for treating heartburn.

risks_warnings.title: Reaction to aspartame (phenylalanine)
risks_warnings.description: Sodium bicarbonate contains aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist about other choices to treat your symptoms.

description_processed.orig: Sodium bicarbonate contains aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist about other choices to treat your symptoms.

carousel_items: Take at the first sign of discomfort.
You might need to take more than once a day but pay attention to the instructions on your bottle to avoid overdosing.
You need to separate Tums from some medications to avoid interactions.
If heartburn doesn't improve or lasts more than 2 weeks, talk to your doctor.
People with kidney disease on dialysis may need to take a lower dose or avoid use. Your doctor can do blood tests to see if it's safe to use.
Don't take if you have high blood calcium levels.

basics.benefits_moa: Tums is an antacid. It counteracts the effects of stomach acid to relieve heartburn and acid tummy (indigestion).
basics.bottom_line: Tums gives quick relief for heartburn, but don't expect it to last all day.
downsides: Doesn't last very long.
Other antacids like Zantac (H2 blockers) and omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can work better and last longer.
Some chalky aftertaste.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't last very long.
Other antacids like Zantac (H2 blockers) and omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can work better and last longer.
Some chalky aftertaste.

upsides: Works really fast.
Available over the counter without a prescription.
Cheap.

upsides_processed.orig: Works really fast.
Available over the counter without a prescription.
Cheap.

drugs.name: Tums

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take at the first sign of discomfort.
You might need to take more than once a day but pay attention to the instructions on your bottle to avoid overdosing.
You need to separate Tums from some medications to avoid interactions.
If heartburn doesn't improve or lasts more than 2 weeks, talk to your doctor.
People with kidney disease on dialysis may need to take a lower dose or avoid use. Your doctor can do blood tests to see if it's safe to use.
Don't take if you have high blood calcium levels.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Tums.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Tums.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: High blood calcium
risks_warnings.description: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Tums can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of calcium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Tums; a different antacid would be better for you.
risk_factors: Taking high doses of Vitamin D

description_processed.orig: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Tums can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of calcium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Tums; a different antacid would be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney stones
risks_warnings.description: Tums contains calcium.  Calcium can be an ingredient in some kidney stones.  If you have had kidney stones in the past (especially the calcium-containing kind) be careful using Tums. Use the lowest dose for the shortest time possible or just play it safe and use a different antacid instead.

description_processed.orig: Tums contains calcium.  Calcium can be an ingredient in some kidney stones.  If you have had kidney stones in the past (especially the calcium-containing kind) be careful using Tums. Use the lowest dose for the shortest time possible or just play it safe and use a different antacid instead.

carousel_items: Works best if you take it with a full glass of water.
Starts working in one hour.
If heartburn doesn't improve or lasts more than 2 weeks, talk to your doctor.
People with kidney disease may need to take a lower dose.

basics.benefits_moa: Zantac is an H2 blocker. It blocks the chemical histamine, which lowers acid production in your stomach. This treats heartburn and helps ulcers heal.
basics.bottom_line: Zantac works well for heartburn but may not last as long or start working as quickly as other antacids.
downsides: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Ranitidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Ranitidine (H2 blockers).

downsides_processed.orig: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Ranitidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Ranitidine (H2 blockers).

upsides: Most people can take Ranitidine without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Ranitidine lasts longer than many other antacids like Maalox and Tums, and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.
Few drug interactions.

upsides_processed.orig: Most people can take Ranitidine without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Ranitidine lasts longer than many other antacids like Maalox and Tums, and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.
Few drug interactions.

userStories.tip: some times i have seen that some physicians used to prescribe renitidine as a co-medicine since it is not of use, & a wast majority of people uses this drug as a medication for Indigestion, Vomiting, etc

I take 300mg daily divided into 2 doses. I have a hiatus hernia and have been taking this medication for most of the last 30 years. I am allergic to any others and would not be without this medication.

drugs.name: Zantac

carousel_items_processed.orig: Works best if you take it with a full glass of water.
Starts working in one hour.
If heartburn doesn't improve or lasts more than 2 weeks, talk to your doctor.
People with kidney disease may need to take a lower dose.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Zantac for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Zantac for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Zantac is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.

description_processed.orig: Zantac is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Attacks of acute porphyria
risks_warnings.description: Zantac can cause attacks of blood disease called acute porphyria.  Don't use Zantac if you have acute porphyria.

description_processed.orig: Zantac can cause attacks of blood disease called acute porphyria.  Don't use Zantac if you have acute porphyria.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: People with sensitivity to phenylketones and phenylalanine should NOT take Zantac "EFFERdose" tablets. This dosage form contains phenylalanine as an ingredient. The other dosage forms of Zantac do not contain phenylalanine.

description_processed.orig: People with sensitivity to phenylketones and phenylalanine should NOT take Zantac "EFFERdose" tablets. This dosage form contains phenylalanine as an ingredient. The other dosage forms of Zantac do not contain phenylalanine.

carousel_items: Can take a few days to start working.
Take Rabeprazole with or without food. It can work better for some people if it's taken 30 minutes before a meal.
Call your doctor if you have watery stools, stomach pain, or a fever because it could be a sign of a serious infection.
Rabeprazole can lower the amount of magnesium in your body. Initial and follow-up blood tests may be needed before starting Rabeprazole.

basics.benefits_moa: Rabeprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI). It lowers the amount of acid in your stomach, treats heartburn, and heals ulcers.
basics.bottom_line: Rabeprazole is an effective medicine to treat heartburn and ulcers, but can be expensive.
downsides: Taking Rabeprazole in high doses or for longer than 1 year can increase the risk for bone fractures, especially if you already have osteoporosis (weak bones).
Many drugs can interact with Rabeprazole, so talk to your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new medicines.
There's no generic version available, so it can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Taking Rabeprazole in high doses or for longer than 1 year can increase the risk for bone fractures, especially if you already have osteoporosis (weak bones).
Many drugs can interact with Rabeprazole, so talk to your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new medicines.
There's no generic version available, so it can be expensive.

upsides: Relieves heartburn symptoms and heals ulcers better than other stomach medicines, such as Pepcid, Tagamet, and Zantac.
Lasts longer than other similar stomach medicines. Most people take it once a day.
Your body won't develop a tolerance to Rabeprazole, so it'll work the same way as long as you need to keep taking it.
Once heartburn symptoms are treated, a low dose of Rabeprazole can be taken daily.

upsides_processed.orig: Relieves heartburn symptoms and heals ulcers better than other stomach medicines, such as Pepcid, Tagamet, and Zantac.
Lasts longer than other similar stomach medicines. Most people take it once a day.
Your body won't develop a tolerance to Rabeprazole, so it'll work the same way as long as you need to keep taking it.
Once heartburn symptoms are treated, a low dose of Rabeprazole can be taken daily.

userStories.tip: Don't mix it with cold and flu medicine, take before eating if taking early in morning. Not doing either of these causes vomiting.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can take a few days to start working.
Take Rabeprazole with or without food. It can work better for some people if it's taken 30 minutes before a meal.
Call your doctor if you have watery stools, stomach pain, or a fever because it could be a sign of a serious infection.
Rabeprazole can lower the amount of magnesium in your body. Initial and follow-up blood tests may be needed before starting Rabeprazole.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Rabeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Rabeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis)
risks_warnings.description: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Rabeprazole.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Rabeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Rabeprazole.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Rabeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: Using medications like Rabeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Rabeprazole or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

description_processed.orig: Using medications like Rabeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Rabeprazole or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

risks_warnings.title: Broken bones
risks_warnings.description: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Rabeprazole (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Rabeprazole.  However, if you need to take Rabeprazole long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
risk_factors: Use of other medications that weaken bones

description_processed.orig: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Rabeprazole (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Rabeprazole.  However, if you need to take Rabeprazole long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.

risks_warnings.title: Low vitamin or mineral levels
risks_warnings.description: All proton pump inhibitor medications, including Rabeprazole, can cause low levels of blood magnesium or vitamin B12. This can happen with as little as 3 months of use but more commonly occurs after you've been using Rabeprazole for a year or more. Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.

description_processed.orig: All proton pump inhibitor medications, including Rabeprazole, can cause low levels of blood magnesium or vitamin B12. This can happen with as little as 3 months of use but more commonly occurs after you've been using Rabeprazole for a year or more. Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.

carousel_items: Take 1 hour before a meal.
Don't chew or crush capsules; swallow them whole.
If you have trouble swallowing you can carefully open the capsules and sprinkle the inside pellets onto applesauce. Swallow the applesauce without chewing or crushing the pellets.

When using Omeprazole long-term, take a calcium citrate with vitamin D supplement daily to prevent bone loss. Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
Get a blood test for your magnesium level once a year; you may need a magnesium supplement while using Omeprazole.
Avoid drug interactions by telling your doctor all of the other medications or herbal supplements you take before starting Omeprazole.

clock.tip: Take on an empty stomach before breakfast.

basics.benefits_moa: Omeprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI). It lowers the amount of acid in your stomach, treats heartburn, and heals ulcers.
basics.bottom_line: Omeprazole gives you long-lasting heartburn relief. Choose the cheapest proton pump inhibitor because they all work equally well for heartburn.
downsides: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Like with other proton pump inhibitors, long-term use can cause weak or broken bones.
Can cause low levels of magnesium in the blood. You might need to take a magnesium supplement if you use Omeprazole long-term.
Although the generic is affordable, other medications might still be cheaper than Omeprazole.
Can interact with other drugs so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Omeprazole.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Like with other proton pump inhibitors, long-term use can cause weak or broken bones.
Can cause low levels of magnesium in the blood. You might need to take a magnesium supplement if you use Omeprazole long-term.
Although the generic is affordable, other medications might still be cheaper than Omeprazole.
Can interact with other drugs so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Omeprazole.

upsides: Most people can take Omeprazole without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Omeprazole lasts longer than other types of antacids (like Zantac, Pepcid, or Tums), and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
In studies it was better than a placebo (sugar pill) and as good as other proton pump inhibitors at treating heartburn.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.

Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.

userStories.identifier: Golf twice a wk, not good but ok for 87.
userStories.tip: Took Nexium for seven years, then found Omerprazole. Worked so well for two years that I cut the caplets in half two years ago. All's well so far. Have forgotten a few times but remember real quick, within two hours, discomfort.
Take in the morning when you get up.

The generics don't work as well as name-brand Prilosec, but it could just be placebo effect. I could get it much cheaper from the pharmacy for awhile (until my prescription plan stopped covering it) so ask your doctor if that's an option.

userStories.identifier: Parent, average weight and activity leve
userStories.tip: Take it at the same time every day.

I was having horrible acid reflux and was diagnosed with Barrett's rings in my esophagus 9 years ago. Since I started taking this simple drug, the acid reflux is completely gone and the ring growth has been arrested.

Skipping a dose or two does not seem to cause problems.   Occasional break-through heartburn easily fixed with Tums.  Even with a large copay it is cheaper if you get a prescription and have it filled at the pharmacy.
Take 40 mg case I have Barrett and risk of oesaphageal cancer good product better ones out there but does the job

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: This pill gave me an uncertain feeling in my stomach, and my heart burn didn't really go although it did reduce. Stopped taking them in favour of ranitidine and gaviscon.

I take 10mg every morning at least an hour before I eat something. As long as I follow this rule every day, I never have heartburn. If I don't, I will get heartburn regularly over even the most mildest foods.
Take in the morning before eating ... huge help.
Taking it every day 30mins before breakfast results in no heartburn at all. But im concerned about long term side effects like problems in B12 inhibit, calcium, colesterol

carousel_items: Reglan can cause drowsiness, so avoid driving and other activities that require you to be alert.
Most doctors prescribe Reglan 4 times a day, 30 minutes before each meal, and before bed.
Dont drink alcohol or take with other drugs that slow your body down until you know how Reglan affects you.
Contact a doctor immediately if you begin to have repetitive movements of the eyes, tongue, face, arm, or legs.
It can take several weeks before Reglan works best for diabetic gastroparesis; so dont give up on it.

basics.benefits_moa: Reglan is an antiemetic and prokinetic medication that helps contract and stimulate your stomach. This helps to pass food along, while lowering acid reflux, nausea, and vomiting.
basics.bottom_line: Reglan helps get your digestive system moving and lowers nausea and vomiting. Using it a long time can come with serious, potentially permanent side effects.
downsides: You cant use Reglan for more than 12 weeks since it can lead to involuntary movements of the eyes, tongue, face, arm, or legs.
Reglan is no longer recommended for acid reflux because of its long list of side effects and the availability of better medications.
It can take several weeks for Reglan to begin working for diabetic gastroparesis.
If you take Reglan for more than 12 weeks, there can be serious side effects and you'll have to get your blood checked often.

downsides_processed.orig: You cant use Reglan for more than 12 weeks since it can lead to involuntary movements of the eyes, tongue, face, arm, or legs.
Reglan is no longer recommended for acid reflux because of its long list of side effects and the availability of better medications.
It can take several weeks for Reglan to begin working for diabetic gastroparesis.
If you take Reglan for more than 12 weeks, there can be serious side effects and you'll have to get your blood checked often.

upsides: Reglan stops the chance of vomiting for about one-third of the people who take it.
Gets stomach fluids moving after surgery or during diabetic gastroparesis. Works well for acid reflux when other medications dont.
Comes in a generic version, and in multiple forms.

upsides_processed.orig: Reglan stops the chance of vomiting for about one-third of the people who take it.
Gets stomach fluids moving after surgery or during diabetic gastroparesis. Works well for acid reflux when other medications dont.
Comes in a generic version, and in multiple forms.

userStories.indication: nausea or vomitting caused my morning sickness
userStories.tip: Was glad my pharmacist warned me about diarrhea and tremors as potential side effects.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I was prescribed Reglan for gastroparesis.  It ended up sending me into a deep, suicidal depression.  A lot of other people have experienced this - I would not recommend taking it unless you have no choice and can be well supervised

drugs.name: Reglan

labeled_indications.indication: Stomach emptying problem caused by diabetes
Nausea and vomiting caused by surgery
Nausea and vomiting caused by chemotherapy

off-label_indications.indication: Stomach emptying problem not caused by diabetes

carousel_items_processed.orig: Reglan can cause drowsiness, so avoid driving and other activities that require you to be alert.
Most doctors prescribe Reglan 4 times a day, 30 minutes before each meal, and before bed.
Dont drink alcohol or take with other drugs that slow your body down until you know how Reglan affects you.
Contact a doctor immediately if you begin to have repetitive movements of the eyes, tongue, face, arm, or legs.
It can take several weeks before Reglan works best for diabetic gastroparesis; so dont give up on it.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormal and involuntary muscle movements
risks_warnings.description: Reglan can cause muscle stiffness, feelings of restlessness (like you need to move around), and abnormal or uncontrollable facial or body movements, which could be a sign of tardive dyskinesia (TD). Let your doctor know if you experience any of these symptoms. Reglan should not be taken for more than 12 weeks, because these symptoms can become permanent. There is currently no known effective treatment for TD, although, in some patients TD may go away.

description_processed.orig: Reglan can cause muscle stiffness, feelings of restlessness (like you need to move around), and abnormal or uncontrollable facial or body movements, which could be a sign of tardive dyskinesia (TD). Let your doctor know if you experience any of these symptoms. Reglan should not be taken for more than 12 weeks, because these symptoms can become permanent. There is currently no known effective treatment for TD, although, in some patients TD may go away.

risks_warnings.title: Depression
risks_warnings.description: People taking Reglan can experience symptoms of mental depression. This can occur in people with or without a history of depression.

description_processed.orig: People taking Reglan can experience symptoms of mental depression. This can occur in people with or without a history of depression.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with Reglan. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, stiff muscles, excess sweating, increased heart rate or blood pressure, and confusion. Get medical attention immediately.
